name: Foula Pier to South Ness and Da Sneck

ai.summary: A coastal hike from Foula Pier to South Ness and Da Sneck covering about 12.1 km of rugged coast, moorland and remote shorelines. Rated moderate, the route delivers exposed cliffside sections, seabird habitats and remote scenery with limited facilities.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of stony coastal paths, grassy moorland, and uneven terrain with short climbs. Sections along cliff edges are exposed and can be slippery when wet; boggy patches and damp grass are common. Tracks may be rough and remote, with limited services and protection from weather.
ai.safety_notes: This is a remote UK coastal route. Weather can change rapidly; wind, cold, rain and fog are common. Carry a map and compass even when using GPS, inform someone of your plan, and start early in daylight. Be wary of cliff edges, rising tides and slippery rocks. Mobile reception is often poor on Foula; bring a charged device and power bank, plus basic first aid and emergency gear.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Lightweight emergency bivvy or space blanket
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Fully charged mobile phone and power bank
Sunscreen and sunglasses (even on cloudy days)
Gaiters (optional but helpful in boggy or muddy sections)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly May to September) offer longer daylight and better visibility, but shoulder seasons can bring stronger winds and more changeable weather.

seo.title: Foula Pier to South Ness and Da Sneck — 12.1 km Moderate Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover a 12.1 km moderate coastal hike from Foula Pier to South Ness and Da Sneck in the UK. Remote cliffs, moorland and seabird habitat with changeable weather; plan accordingly.
seo.h1: Foula Pier to South Ness and Da Sneck — 12.1 km Coastal Hike
